title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 519 of 2020) and the Enterprise, Trade
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Companies Act 2014 (Section 897)
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Companies Act 2014 (Section 897) 

Order 2020. 

(2) This Order comes into operation on 16 December 2020.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited company act 2014 (section 897) order 2020 (2) order come operation 16 december 2020

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 519 of 2020) and the Enterprise, Trade
heading: 2. The sole means to be used to deliver Form A1 which is prescribed
text_raw:
2. The sole means to be used to deliver Form A1 which is prescribed 
under Regulation 3 of the Companies Act 2014 (Forms) Regulations 2015 
(S.I. No. 147 of 2015) to the Registrar shall be those provided for under the 
Electronic Commerce Act (No. 27 of 2000) effected in a manner which 
complies with any requirements of the Registrar of the kind referred to in 
sections 12(2)(b) and 13(2)(a) of that Act. 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 15 December 2020 

ROBERT TROY, 
 Minister of State at the Department of Enterprise, Trade and 

Employment. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 25th December, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [629] 3

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 519 of 2020) and the Enterprise, Trade
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

The purpose of this Order is to provide that Form A1 prescribed under the 
Companies Act 2014 (Forms) Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 147 of 2015), may 
only be delivered to the Registrar of Companies by the means provided for 
under the Electronic Commerce Act 2000, effected in a manner which 
complies with any requirements of the Registrar of the kind referred to in 
sections 12(2)(b) and 13(2)(a) of that Act. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [629]
